column4: oh boy. my ubuntu laptop (specifically, the optical drive) has been giving me FITS today.
I cannot open/close the drive without using the terminal
and any discs that are inserted come up blank
exhausted the search on the ubuntu forums, no help. google search does nothing either.
my /etc/fstab looks right.. i have no clue what to do.
(keep in mind that while I have been using ubuntu for ~6 months, my knowledge of linux is very very small)
anyone here have any experience in optical drives becoming stubborn as mules overnight?
have you tried booting a known correct live CD, see if it isnt a hardware problem
I have a winxp disk around, it will go to the blue setup screen.

maybe make an image of a disk and then check dmesg for errors? try 'sudo dmesg -c > /dev/null;dd if=/dev/sda of=~/disc.iso;dmesg' replacing sda with the device your cdrom occupies, it will take a long time but would see if your getting any read errors etc
just got some rather weird error messages. might be a hardware issue after all. want me to msg you my return?
drop it into pastebin.ca and paste the link here, better than a pm, then everyone can see :
looks like hardware problem im afrid, its having trouble seeking
also its helpful to put the person your speaking to's name prefixing what you say, it highlights it on the other side, almost lost your reply in the chatter :)
ha, wouldn't you believe the laptop's warranty went out around two weeks ago. oh well, could be worse all in all. thanks a bunch for the response, i can quit crying over spilled milk i suppose.
maybe try a lens head cleaner
